bcbioSingleCell
  • Reference
  • News

Bracket-Based Subsetting

Extract genes by row and cells by column from a bcbioSingleCell object.

# S4 method for bcbioSingleCell,ANY,ANY,ANY
[(x, i, j, ..., drop = FALSE)

Arguments

x

object from which to extract element(s) or in which to replace element(s).
i

indices specifying elements to extract or replace. Indices are numeric or character vectors or empty (missing) or NULL. Numeric values are coerced to integer as by as.integer (and hence truncated towards zero). Character vectors will be matched to the names of the object (or for matrices/arrays, the dimnames): see ‘Character indices’ below for further details.

For [-indexing only: i, j, … can be logical vectors, indicating elements/slices to select. Such vectors are recycled if necessary to match the corresponding extent. i, j, … can also be negative integers, indicating elements/slices to leave out of the selection.

When indexing arrays by [ a single argument i can be a matrix with as many columns as there are dimensions of x; the result is then a vector with elements corresponding to the sets of indices in each row of i.

An index value of NULL is treated as if it were integer(0).
j

indices specifying elements to extract or replace. Indices are numeric or character vectors or empty (missing) or NULL. Numeric values are coerced to integer as by as.integer (and hence truncated towards zero). Character vectors will be matched to the names of the object (or for matrices/arrays, the dimnames): see ‘Character indices’ below for further details.

For [-indexing only: i, j, … can be logical vectors, indicating elements/slices to select. Such vectors are recycled if necessary to match the corresponding extent. i, j, … can also be negative integers, indicating elements/slices to leave out of the selection.

When indexing arrays by [ a single argument i can be a matrix with as many columns as there are dimensions of x; the result is then a vector with elements corresponding to the sets of indices in each row of i.

An index value of NULL is treated as if it were integer(0).
...

Additional arguments.
drop

For matrices and arrays. If TRUE the result is coerced to the lowest possible dimension (see the examples). This only works for extracting elements, not for the replacement. See drop for further details.

Value

bcbioSingleCell.

See also

  • help("[", "base").

  • selectSamples() for subsetting based on sample metadata.

Examples

load(system.file("extdata/bcb.rda", package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

cells <- colnames(bcb)[1:100]
head(cells)
#> [1] "run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTAGGTA" "run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTCGATT"
#> [3] "run1_AGAGGATA_AAACCGCC_GAGTTTCG" "run1_AGAGGATA_AAACCGCC_TAGCCTCG"
#> [5] "run1_AGAGGATA_AAACGATC_TTTACCCT" "run1_AGAGGATA_AAACTACA_CCACATTA"
genes <- rownames(bcb)[1:100]
head(genes)
#> [1] "ENSG00000000457" "ENSG00000002586" "ENSG00000002933" "ENSG00000004939"
#> [5] "ENSG00000005022" "ENSG00000005100"

# Subset by cell identifiers
bcb[, cells]
#> class: bcbioSingleCell 
#> dim: 1000 100 
#> metadata(34): version pipeline ... subset originalVersion
#> assays(1): assay
#> rownames(1000): ENSG00000000457 ENSG00000002586 ... ENSG00000283957
#>   ENSG00000284526
#> rowData names(11): ensgene symbol ... seqCoordSystem entrez
#> colnames(100): run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTAGGTA
#>   run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTCGATT ... run1_AGAGGATA_CCTATTTA_TGCAAGGG
#>   run1_AGAGGATA_CGATGGCA_TCCCGTAG
#> colData names(7): nUMI nGene ... mitoRatio nCount

# Subset by genes
bcb[genes, ]
#> class: bcbioSingleCell 
#> dim: 100 500 
#> metadata(34): version pipeline ... subset originalVersion
#> assays(1): assay
#> rownames(100): ENSG00000000457 ENSG00000002586 ... ENSG00000091136
#>   ENSG00000091436
#> rowData names(11): ensgene symbol ... seqCoordSystem entrez
#> colnames(500): run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTAGGTA
#>   run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTCGATT ... run2_AGAGGATA_TGTTATCA_ACGCAGAG
#>   run2_AGAGGATA_TGTTATCA_CAAGTCAT
#> colData names(7): nUMI nGene ... mitoRatio nCount

# Subset by both genes and cells
bcb[genes, cells]
#> class: bcbioSingleCell 
#> dim: 100 100 
#> metadata(34): version pipeline ... subset originalVersion
#> assays(1): assay
#> rownames(100): ENSG00000000457 ENSG00000002586 ... ENSG00000091136
#>   ENSG00000091436
#> rowData names(11): ensgene symbol ... seqCoordSystem entrez
#> colnames(100): run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTAGGTA
#>   run1_AGAGGATA_AAACACTA_CTTCGATT ... run1_AGAGGATA_CCTATTTA_TGCAAGGG
#>   run1_AGAGGATA_CGATGGCA_TCCCGTAG
#> colData names(7): nUMI nGene ... mitoRatio nCount
